item.title: Nebula level10 write-up
item.description: In Level10 we are given a vulnerable piece of code: #include <stdlib.h> #include <unistd.h> #include <sys/types.h> #include <stdio.h> #include <fcntl.h> #include <errno.h> #include <sys/socket.h> #include <netinet/in.h> #include <string.h> int main(int argc, char **argv) { char *file; char *host; if(argc < 3) { printf("%s file host\n\tsends file to host if you have access to it\n", argv[0]); exit(1); } file = argv[1]; host = argv[2]; if(access(argv[1], R_OK) == 0) { int fd; int ffd; int rc; struct sockaddr_in sin; char buffer[4096]; printf("Connecting to %s:18211 .
